languageKey.label: Check for xClasses
The way of registering xClasses has been changed. Check if xClassing is used.
When changing you might also need to change the location/name of the hook or add the file to the ext_autoload.php.
require_once // include_once
Using require_once, include_once, include or require on core files will fail since files have been relocated.

While namespacing all the classes have been restructured, relocated and renamed. Including old files therefore will fail. Since TYPO3 CMS 4.3 there is an autoloader which makes manual requiring superfluous: simply use the needed classes.
Deprecated static methods
Calling deprecated methods will give an error as they have been removed.
From the 4.5 release multiple methods have been deprecated. Changing them to their respective new methods would solve the issue.
Deprecated view helpers
Calling deprecated view helpers will give an error as they have been removed.
From the 4.5 release some view helpers have been deprecated. Changing them to their respective new view helpers would solve the issue.
Use of mysql_* functions
Using mysql_* functions instead of the database API will give errors due the the change to MySQLi.
As the database API has been switched to MySQLi, the mysql_* function don't work anymore. Replace them with API calls.
Dam Classes
Checks for Code that creates instances of DAM-Classes.
Since DAM won't be usable in 6.2 anymore, you should remove all calls to DAM-Methods and change them to use FAL/Media.
